Comment.Language: For the Feast of the Cross chanted in the Hosanna tune:

Text.Language: Etauen nic~qai n~hir/nikon: n~te Kwctantinoc e~qoun e~Rako]: je mas~yam m~v~ro n~nierv/oui: a~ouwn m~v~ro n~niekkl/cia.
When the letters of peace: from Constantine were brought into Alexandria: saying, â€œClose the doors of the temples! Open the doors of the churches!â€?

The bishops heard and they rejoiced: and the priests were delighted: and the seven orders of the church: glorified the God of heaven.

As n~lac n~cwmatikoc: nas~caji e~peknis] n~yel/l: w~ pilaoc m~pictoc: qen niekkl/cia t/rou.
Which human tongue: will be able to speak of your great joys: O faithful people: in all churches?

Wouniatk w~ Kwctantinoc: je aktanqo m~pinah]: eybe vai a~V] tanqok: qen y~metouro n~te niv/oui.
Blessed are you O Constantine, for you revived the faith, for this God gave you life, in the kingdom of heaven.

Pray to the Lord on our behalf, my lord the King Constantine, and Queen Helen, that He may forgive us our sins.
